physical_examinations.vital_signs: Oxygen saturation approximately 80%, indicating need for supplemental oxygen.
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Severe pulmonary disease with dyspnea at rest; neurologically intact cranial nerve function except for left Horner syndrome; diminished reflexes with 3/5 function of left upper extremity; left-sided sensory loss in a C6â€“T2 distribution.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initial presentation included bilateral lower-extremity weakness, which progressed to severe pulmonary distress and neurological deficits over time.
